titlestmt.titleproper: New England Nuclear Corporation annual reports and product catalogs 1959-2003 1959-1981
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012

did.unittitle: New England Nuclear Corporation annual reports and product catalogs

bioghist.p: Paul McNulty was the Vice President of Marketing at New England Nuclear Corporation (NEN). Boston-based New England Nuclear Corporation, incorporated in 1956, produced radioactive chemicals and supplies for use in scientific research and for application in the medical, biological, and physical sciences. In a bid to expand its business into medical research, DuPont purchased New England Nuclear in 1981. DuPont sold NEN's medical diagnostic business in 1996 and the remainder of the company (then called NEN Life Sciences Products) in 1997. PerkinElmer, a drug research and development company, bought NEN in 2000.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of marketing materials and company business reports from New England Nuclear Corporation. The marketing materials include all of the sales and product brochures in use by the company in 1981, with publication dates ranging from 1976 to 1981. Reports include annual reports from 1963 to 1981, and interim reports from 1977 to 1980, notices of annual stockholder meetings, and stock prospectuses. The collection also includes a 2003 memorial booklet for Edward Shapiro, co-founder of NEN, an annual report from Tracerlab (where NEN's cofounders worked prior to launching the company), and miscellaneous brochures, advertisements, and clippings.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
